wikipedia_page.main: Stephen Roy Middleton (born 28 March 1953) is an English former footballer who played as a goalkeeper for local rivals Southampton and Portsmouth in the 1970s.

response: In September 1976, Boulton joined Southampton on loan for a month, as manager Lawrie McMenemy had lost confidence in Ian Turner (who had helped "the Saints" win the FA Cup only a few months earlier) and reserve 'keeper Steve Middleton. He played five league games for The Dell club, winning two and losing two, including a 6–2 defeat at Charlton Athletic and victory at Wolverhampton Wanderers by the same scoreline; in his five games, he conceded 11 goals.
*Steve Middleton, footballer, was born in Portsmouth
